Label.title: Centralized exchanges
Label.decs: There are traditional cryptocurrency exchanges for trading fiats to cryptos as well as cryptos to cryptos. Binance and Coinbase are two options to consider.

Label.title: Decentralized exchanges
Label.decs: Cryptocurrency exchanges are based on smart contracts that offer crypto-to-crypto trading pairs. The Uniswap protocol, the 0x protocol, and Kyber can be used as examples.

Label.title: Exchanges that are hybrid
Label.decs: Hybrid exchanges are a mix of CEX and DEX, offering fiat-to-crypto and crypto-to-crypto trading pairs while retaining the private keys of traders.
